dict.string: What happened before the Big Bang according to Kabbalah?
The descent of the spiritual Behinot, Partzufim, Sefirot & worlds
We cannot say anything about what happened before the Big Bang
The universe existed at a state of infinite density & temperature
All the matter in the universe existed smaller than a subatomic particle
What is matter according to Kabbalah?
A physical substance that occupies space
The desire to bestow pleasure
Objects that take up space and contain mass
The desire to receive pleasure
Which of the following is NOT what the moment is called when the spark of bestowal permeates matter (i.e. the desire to receive pleasure) from above downward?
Breaking of the vessels
Crossing the Machsom
Shattering of the collective soul
Big Bang
Which of the following is the correct order of the four phases of evolutionary development?
1-Speaking, 2-Animate, 3-Vegetative, 4-Still
1-Still, 2-Vegetative, 3-Animate, 4-Speaking
1-Vegetative, 2-Still, 3-Animate, 4-Speaking
1-Still, 2-Speaking, 3-Animate, 4-Vegetative
How could Baal HaSulam, the 20th Century's most renowned Kabbalist, write about how the Earth was created, if Kabbalists only write about what they clearly attain & perceive?
Kabbalists attain the ability to physically time travel to any period
Kabbalists attain Nature at its causal level & can thus perceive how the causes of life cascade to their consequences in this world
Baal HaSulam was permitted to theorize how the Earth was created based on his attainments
Kabbalists sometimes write about situations that they do not clearly attain & perceive

How could the Ari, the great Kabbalist who passed away in 1572 (three centuries before Charles Darwin), state that monkeys were an intermediary phase of development between animals and humans, i.e. since Kabbalists only write about what they clearly attain & perceive?
This specific phenomenon was theorized by the Ari
Kabbalists attain Nature's Reshimot (records), which clearly show how Nature's causal forces expand into our world's perception
The Ari saw the evolution of the universe in a dream, then expressed it to his students, of which one wrote this specific phenomenon
Kabbalists sometimes write about situations that they do not clearly attain & perceive
What significant event in humanity's evolution took place approx. 5773 years ago?
It was the time of the first signs of beliefs in humanity, e.g. totemism & animism
The first person appeared (called Adam) who questioned the meaning of life, attained spirituality & wrote a book about it titled "The Angel Raziel"
The Kabbalist Abraham developed humanity's first Kabbalistic group
It was the time of the birth of the first religions: Judaism, then Christianity, then Islam
Which of the following attributes the still level of development in the universe?
Plant life
Corals
The desire for respect
Stars, galaxies, planets, rocks, asteroids
Which of the following desires attribute the speaking level of development in a person?
Honor
Knowledge
Spirituality
Family
Which of the following is NOT an attribute of the year 1995 and onward in humanity's evolution?
The desire for spirituality would begin developing in humanity & thus humanity would begin increasingly needing the wisdom of Kabbalah to fulfill this desire
Crises in all areas of life would be exponentially increasing
Kabbalah dissemination started becoming much more widespread
Increasing optimism in humanity about the world and its future
